column4: hmm, don't know about HTP374 but i know with debian i used to be able to install on my HTP372 system, as long as i turned off dma probing at boot until i could create a custom patched kernel.
How do I turn off DMA probing?
I can make the custom kernel..Just cant get in to do so.. heh
try ideX=noautotune, replacing X with the appropriate number. eg, i used ide2=noautotune ide3=noautotune, since ide0 and ide1 were my main controller
